column4: hi, is there any command that you can use to  append a file to another file?
hmm, when i do test1.txt >> test2.txst i get test1.txt: command not found.  any ideas?
in the folder i'm running the command in
hmmm I am not too sure why it isn't working
cat will print to the terminal what is in the file test1.txt and the >> pipes it into the other file specifified
becareful because using a single > will overwrite the second file, I would recommend always backing up the second file before using it
mmk, i'm writing a shell script, so it should be fine, right?
ya you should be okay, less change of accidentally only putting one > in but it always is a good idea to backup if your concerned about losing a system file or any work
